‍TERRORIZE.Definition: to make someone feel very frightened by threatening to kill or hurt them

‍GRUESOME.Definition: extremely unpleasant and shocking, and usually dealing with death or injury

‍INFLUX.Definition: the fact of a large number of people or things arriving at the same time

‍PERSECUTION.Definition: the treatment of someone unfairly or cruelly over a long period of time because of their race, religion, or political beliefs

‍ALCOHOLISM.Definition: the condition of being an alcoholic, dependent on alcohol

‍RIFE.Definition: if something unpleasant is rife, it is very common or happens a lot

‍WIDESPREAD.Definition: existing or happening in many places and/or among many people

‍BROTHELS.Definition: a place where people go and pay to have sex with prostitutes

‍COMMONPLACE.Definition: happening often or often seen or experienced and so not considered to be special

‍SADISTIC.Definition: a person who gets pleasure, sometimes sexual, by being cruel to or hurting another person

‍BOOM.Definition: an increase in something, or a time when something becomes more popular

‍EMBELLISH.Definition: to add or change some details of a story, usually to make it more interesting or exciting

‍SEIZED UPON.Definition: to use or bring attention to something for your advantage

‍HEIGHT.Definition: the time when a situation or event is strongest or most full of activity

‍CIRCULATION.Definition: the number of people that a newspaper or magazine is regularly sold to

‍AWARENESS.Definition: knowing that something exists, or having knowledge or experience of a particular thing

‍DETAINED.Definition: to force someone officially to stay in a place

‍TO NO AVAIL.Definition: without any success or any effect

‍AT LARGE.Definition: a person who is at large is not in prison

‍PATROLLED.Definition: (especially of soldiers or the police) to go around an area or a building to see if there is any trouble or danger

‍VICINITY.Definition: the area around a place or where the speaker is

‍ANATOMICAL.Definition: relating to the scientific study and representation of the physical body and how its parts are arranged

‍ARISTOCRAT.Definition: a class of people who hold high social rank

‍GET AWAY WITH.Definition: to succeed in avoiding punishment for something

‍EVADE.Definition: to avoid or escape from someone or something

‍PREVENTATIVE.Definition: intended to stop something before it happens

‍NONE THE WISER.Definition: to be none the wiser also means to not be aware of something

‍CONCLUSIVE.Definition: proving that something is TRUE, or ending any doubt

‍METHODOLOGY.Definition: a system of ways of doing, teaching, or studying something

‍POINT THE FINGER.Definition: to say that someone should be blamed or is guilty of something

‍TRAUMATIZED.Definition: severely shocked and upset in a way that causes lasting emotional pain

‍SUPPOSED.Definition: believed by many people to be true, but not proven and often doubted by the person who is speaking or writing

‍ACCUSER.Definition: a person who claims that someone has done something morally wrong, illegal, or unkind

‍ACCOMPLICE.Definition: a person who helps someone else to commit a crime or to do something morally wrong

‍ECCENTRIC.Definition: strange or unusual, sometimes in a humorous way

‍POSTED BAIL.Definition: to pay money, especially so that a person who has been accused of committing a crime can be free until their trial

‍JAIL.Definition: a place where criminals are kept to punish them for their crimes, or where people accused of crimes are kept while waiting for their trials

‍EXTRADITE.Definition: to make someone return for trial to another country or state where they have been accused of doing something illegal

‍PERUSE.Definition: to read through something, especially in order to find the part you are interested in

‍IT'S TELLING.Definition: showing the truth about a situation or showing what someone really thinks
